metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18356 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow in path handling lead to a use after free in Skia inGoogle Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
